data.title: Nero Severn: Information Broker
data.flavor: "Credits spend anywhere in the worlds, but there are other forms of currency."

data.text: +1[mu] +1[link] Whenever you jack out, the Corp reveals 1 card from HQ at random. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Reflection
data.flavor: "I'm on a need-to-know basis. I need to know everything." -Nero Severn

data.text:
[click]: Look at the top X cards of your stack and arrange them in any order. X is the number of copies of Spy Camera installed.
[trash]: Look at the top card of R&D.
Limit 6 per deck.
data.title: Spy Camera

data.text: Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. [trash], pay the trash cost of a rezzed card: Trash that card.
data.title: Political Operative
data.flavor: Leverage, secrets, access, and influence are currency as valuable as credits. But credits work, too.

data.text: 1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with 3 or more subtypes. 1[credit]: +1 strength. 2[credit]: Swap Sadyojata with a deva program from your grip.
data.title: Sadyojata
data.flavor: The Creator.

data.title: "Freedom Through Equality"
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. When you steal an agenda, add "Freedom Through Equality" to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

data.title: Akshara Sareen
data.flavor: "Our shared humanity is our greatest strength. And as we share more broadly, our strength grows, not dwindles."
data.text: Each player has 1 additional [click] to spend during his or her turn.

data.flavor: "Bureaucracy and red tape have been weaponized." -Fake-ir
data.title: Councilman
data.text: Whenever the Corp rezzes an asset or upgrade, you may pay credits equal to its rez cost and trash Councilman. If you do, derez that asset or upgrade. The Corp cannot rez it for the remainder of this turn.

Place 3 agenda counters on Voting Machine Initiative when you score it.
When the Runner's turn begins, you may spend 1 hosted agenda counter. If you do, the Runner loses [click], if able.
data.title: Voting Machine Initiative

data.text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 operation from Archives to HQ if there is no ice protecting this server.
data.title: Clone Suffrage Movement
data.flavor: "Our research says the public views clones as more human than bioroids. Historically, this has been a liability. Let's make it a strength."

data.text: When your turn begins, do 1 net damage if there is no ice protecting this server.
data.flavor: "There's no conflict of interest here. These are complex issues with highly technical minutiae. It's only natural that the experts should lay down the guidelines."
data.title: Bio-Ethics Association

data.flavor: "Politics is a dirty business. But so is business." -Krishnan Sareen
data.title: Political Dealings
data.text: Whenever you draw an agenda, you may reveal and install it.

data.title: "Clones are not People"
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. When you score an agenda, add "Clones are not People" to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
When your turn begins, you may draw 3 cards if there is no ice protecting this server. If you do, add 1 card from HQ to the bottom of R&D.
data.flavor: Being a Mumbad sensie star means a glamorous life, though it is lived in constant fear of blackmail-or worse-from orgcrime.
data.title: Sensie Actors Union

data.flavor: "Money is speech and I am listening intently." -Krishnan Sareen
data.title: Commercial Bankers Group
data.text: When your turn begins, gain 3[credit] if there is no ice protecting this server.
[click]: Search R&D for an alliance card, reveal it, and play or install it (paying all costs). Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Mumbad City Hall
data.flavor: Mumbad's public city corporation is tightly connected to all the other corporations.
Efficiency means profiting from things everyone was doing anyway.
data.title: Bailiff
data.text:
Whenever the Runner breaks a subroutine on Bailiff, gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run.
Whenever you rez a card in or protecting this server (not including Surat City Grid), you may rez another card, lowering the rez cost by 2. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Surat City Grid
data.flavor: The political centre of Mumbad.

es.title: Hacer Una Gran Entrada
es.flavor: A veces te das cuenta en un instante de quienes son tus amigos de verdad.
es.text:
Juega esta carta sólo al gastar tu primer [click].
Mira las 6 primeras cartas de tu Montón. Puedes destruir cualquiera de esas cartas y colocar el resto en cualquier orden.

data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Look at the top 6 cards of your stack. You may trash any of those cards and arrange the rest in any order.
data.title: Making an Entrance
data.flavor: Sometimes in an instant you realize who your friends really are.

data.title: Salsette Slums
data.flavor: "Underestimate those people at your own peril." -Akshara Sareen

es.text: Una vez por turno, cuando pagues el coste de destrucción de una carta a la que accedas, puedes retirar esa carta de la partida en lugar de destruirla.
es.flavor: "Subestima a esta gente por tu cuenta y riesgo." -Akshara Sareen
es.title: Chabolas de Salsette

data.text:
Once per turn, you may pay the trash cost of a card you access that is not in Archives to remove that card from the game.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>

data.title: Exclusive Party
data.flavor: The more parties she attended, the more they trusted her. The more they trusted her, the more entertaining her scams became.

es.text:
Roba 1 carta. Gana 1[credit] por cada copia de Fiesta Exclusiva que haya en tu Pila.
Límite de 6 por mazo.
es.flavor: La confianza de los demás en ella aumentaba con cada fiesta a la que asistía. Cuando más confiaba en ella, más entretenidas se volvían sus estafas.
es.title: Fiesta Exclusiva

data.text:
Draw 1 card. Gain 1[credit] for each copy of Exclusive Party in your heap.
Limit 6 per deck.

es.text: 1[credit]: Rompe una subrutina de un hielo que tenga exactamente 1 subrutina. 1[credit]: +1 punto de fueza. 2[credit]: Intercambia Vamadeva con un programa deva de tu Empuñadura.
es.title: Vamadeva
es.flavor: La preservadora.

data.text: 1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with exactly 1 subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. 2[credit]: Swap Vamadeva with a deva program from your grip.
data.title: Vamadeva
data.flavor: The Preserver.

es.title: Brahmán
es.text: 1[credit]: Rompe un máximo de 2 subrutinas de un hielo. 2[credit]: +1 punto de fuerza. Siempre que termine un enfrentamiento con un huelo en el que hayas usado Brahmán para romper una subrutina, añade 1 programa instalado que no sea virus a la parte superior de tu Montón.

data.text: 1[credit]: Break up to 2 ice subroutines. 2[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Brahman to break a subroutine ends, add 1 installed non-virus program to the top of your stack.
data.title: Brahman

data.text:
When your turn begins, you may choose a server.
The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, draw 2 cards.

es.text:
Cuando comience tu turno, puedes elegir un servidor.
La primera vez que realices una incursión con éxito contra ese servidor en este turno, en lugar de acceder a cartas, roba 2 cartas.
es.flavor: "Cualquiera que pueda permitirse unos elefantes enanos puede permitirse ser mi amigo." -Fake-ir
es.title: Mecenas

data.title: Patron

es.flavor: "Mira mi nuevo buga." -2xTiger
es.title: Saltador Deportivo
es.text:
+1[link]
[trash]: Roba 3 cartas.

data.text:
+1[link]
[trash]: Draw 3 cards.
data.title: Sports Hopper
data.flavor: "Check out my new ride." -2xTiger

data.title: Bazaar
data.flavor: In these days of digital full-sim browsing and widely available nano-assembly, it takes a special kind of crazy person to go shopping in meatspace. There are millions of them.

es.title: Bazar
es.flavor: En estos días de navegación digital de simulación total y nanomontaje disponible en todas partes, hay que estar un poco loco para ir de compras de forma física. Pero hay millones de locos.
es.text: Siempre que instales un hardware desde tu Empuñadura, puedes instalar otra copia de ese hardware desde tu Empuñadura pagando todos los costes.

data.text: Whenever you install a piece of hardware from your grip, you may install another copy of that hardware from your grip (paying all costs).

es.title: Perfiles de Personalidad
es.text: Siempre que el Runner busque en su Montón o instale una carta desde su pila, debe destruir una carta de su Empuñadura al azar.

data.text: Whenever the Runner searches his or her stack or installs a card from his or her heap, he or she must trash a card from his or her grip at random.
data.title: Personality Profiles

data.flavor: "Very good, sir."
data.title: Jeeves Model Bioroids
data.text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [haas-bioroid] cards in your deck. The first time you spend 3[click] on the same action each turn, gain [click].

es.title: Bioroides Modelo Jeeves
es.flavor: "Muy bien, señor."
es.text: Esta carta cuesta 0 puntos de influencia si tienes 6 o más cartas [hass-bioroid] que no sean alianza en tu mazo. La primera vez que gastes 3[click] en la misma acción en cada turno, gana [click].

Esta carta cuesta 0 puntos de influencia si tienes 6 o más cartas [jinteki] que no sean alianza en tu mazo. Una vez por turno, puedes perder [click] cuando robes una carta. Si lo haces, revela esa carta y una carta de los Archivos del mismo tipo, y luego intercámbialas.
es.title: Raman Rai

data.text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [jinteki] cards in your deck. Once per turn, you may lose [click] when you draw a card. If you do, reveal that card and a card in Archives of the same type, then swap those cards.
data.title: Raman Rai
Upayoga
data.flavor: "Connect two truths. Connect two programs. All is one."

es.text: [subroutine] El runner y tú gastáis en secreto 0[credit]. 1[credit] o 2[credit]. Revelad los créditos gastados. Si el Runner y tú habéis gastado una cantidad de créditos distina, el Runner pierde 2[credit]. [subroutine] Resuelve una subrutina de un hielo psi ejecutado.
es.title: Upayoga
es.flavor: "Conecta dos verdades. Conecta dos programas. Todo es uno."

data.text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, the Runner loses 2[credit]. [subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on a piece of rezzed psi ice.

data.title: Aryabhata Tech
data.flavor: "As the world shrinks, communications becomes the most essential technology." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy

es.text: Siempre que haya un rastreo con éxito, gana 1[credit] y el Runner pierde 1[credit].
es.title: Tecnología Aryabhata
es.flavor: "A medida que el mundo se hace más pequeño, las comunicaciones se convierten en la tecnología más esencia." -Ramesh Gupta, Una Economía Mundial

data.text: Whenever there is a successful trace, gain 1[credit] and the Runner loses 1[credit].

data.title: Salem's Hospitality

es.text: Esta carta cuesta 0 puntos de influencia si tienes 6 o más cartas [nbn] que no sean alianza en tu mazo. Nombra una carta. El Runner revela su Empuñadura y destruye todas las copias de la carta nombrada de su Empuñadura.
es.title: Hospitalidad de Salem

data.text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [nbn] cards in your deck. Name a card. The Runner reveals his or her grip and trashes all copies of the named card from his or her grip.

data.title: Executive Search Firm
data.text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [weyland-consortium] cards in your deck. [click]: Search R&D for an executive, sysop, or character, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

es.title: Firma de Búsqueda de Ejecutivos
es.text: Esta carta cuesta 0 puntos de influencia si tienes 6 o más cartas [weyland-consortium] que no sean alianza en tu mazo. [click]: Busca en I+D un ejecutivo,sysop o personaje, revélalo y añádelo a la SC. Baraja I+D.

data.text: Whenever you rez or play an out-of-faction card (including Indian Union Stock Exchange), gain 1[credit].

es.title: Bolsa de Valores de la Unión India
es.flavor: "La riqueza bien invertida es riqueza ganada." -El Nuevo Evangelio de la Riqueza
es.text: Siempre que ejecutes o juegues una carta que no sea de tu facción (incluyendo Bolsa de Valores de la Unión India), gana 1[credit].

data.flavor: "Wealth wisely invested is wealth earned." -The New Gospel of Wealth
data.title: Indian Union Stock Exchange

data.text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.

es.text:
[subroutine] Destruye 1 programa.
[subroutine] Inflige 2 puntos de daño de red.
es.flavor: El naja naja es el rey de las serpientes.
es.title: Cobra

data.flavor: The naja naja is the king of all serpents.

Localized Product Line
data.flavor: It's the exact same coffee, but the price sure is different.

es.title: Línea de Producción Localizada
es.flavor: Es exactamente el mismo café, pero el precio es muy distinto.
es.text: Busca en I+D cualquier cantidad de copias de una carta, revélalas y añádelas a la SC. Baraja I+D.

data.text: Search R&D for any number of copies of a card, reveal them, and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

data.title: Mumbad Virtual Tour

es.text:
Esta carta cuesta 0 puntos de influencia si tienes 7 o más ventajas en tu mazo.
Si el Runner accede a Visita Virtual de Mumbad mientras esté instalada, debe destruirla si es posible.
es.title: Visita Virtual de Mumbad

data.text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 7 or more assets in your deck.
If the Runner accesses Mumbad Virtual Tour while it is installed, he or she must trash it, if able.
Trash your grip. Make a run. Prevent all damage during this run.
data.title: The Noble Path
Emptied Mind
data.text: When your turn begins, gain [click] if you have no cards in your grip.

Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, the Corp separates all cards in HQ into 2 facedown piles. Access all of the cards in one of the piles; you cannot access any cards in the other pile this run.
data.title: Information Sifting
Out of the Ashes
data.text:
Make a run.
When your turn begins, if Out of the Ashes is in your heap, you may remove it from the game to make a run.
Limit 6 per deck.

data.title: Liberated Chela
data.text: [click],[click],[click],[click],[click], forfeit an agenda: Add Liberated Chela to your score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points. The Corp may forfeit an agenda to prevent this. If he or she does, remove Liberated Chela from the game.

data.title: Temple of the Liberated Mind
data.text: [click]: Place 1 power counter on Temple of the Liberated Mind. Hosted power counter: Gain [click]. Use this ability only on your turn and only once per turn.

data.title: Rebirth
data.text:
Switch your identity with another identity from the same faction. Remove Rebirth from the game instead of trashing it.
Limit 1 per deck.

data.title: Guru Davinder
data.text:
Prevent all net and meat damage.
Whenever Guru Davinder prevents at least 1 net or meat damage, trash him unless you pay 4[credit].

Whenever a run on HQ or R&D ends, place 1 power counter on The Turning Wheel if you stole no agendas during the run. 2 hosted power counters: For the remainder of this run, access 1 additional card from HQ or R&D.
data.title: The Turning Wheel
Brainstorm
data.text: When the Runner encounters Brainstorm, it gains "[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.

data.title: Ravana 1.0
data.text: The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ravana 1.0. [subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice. [subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice.

data.title: Dedicated Neural Net
data.text: The first time there is a successful run on HQ each turn, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, you choose which cards the Runner accesses from HQ for the remainder of this run.

[subroutine] Each player gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.

Puppet Master
data.text: Whenever the Runner makes a successful run, you may place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.

[subroutine]<trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, the Runner reveals his or her grip. Trash each of those cards with a play or install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.
data.title: Waiver
Exchange of Information
data.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Swap an agenda in your score area with an agenda in the Runner's score area.

data.title: Red Tape
data.text: [subroutine] All ice has +3 strength for the remainder of this run.

data.title: Consulting Visit
data.text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [weyland-consortium] cards in your deck. As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click]. Search R&D for an operation and play it (paying all costs). Shuffle R&D.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Vanilla
Fear the Masses
data.text:
Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D. You may reveal X copies of Fear the Masses from your grip to force the Corp to trash X additional cards.
Limit 6 per deck.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a rez cost of 5 or greater. 1[credit]: +1 strength. 2[credit]: Swap Aghora with a deva program from your grip.
data.title: Aghora
data.flavor: The Destroyer.

data.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D.
data.flavor: "They don't want to listen, so we'll just have to crank up the volume."
data.title: Bhagat

data.text:
The Corp cannot win the game unless the Runner is flatlined.
When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on The Black File. When there are 3 or more power counters on The Black File, remove it from the game.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: The Black File

data.text: As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed connection. The Corp cannot advance cards during his or her next turn. Remove The Price of Freedom from the game instead of trashing it.
data.title: The Price of Freedom
Ankusa
data.text: If you use Ankusa to break all subroutines on a barrier during a single encounter, add that barrier to HQ. 2[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

data.title: Rigged Results
data.text: Secretly spend up to 2[credit]. The Corp guesses how much you spent. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, make a run and choose a piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Bypass that ice when you encounter it.

data.title: Magnet
data.flavor: "When the enemy has mastered the battlefield, change the battlefield." -The Playbook
data.text:
When you rez Magnet, host a program on it that is hosted on an installed piece of ice.
The text box of each program hosted on Magnet is blank.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: "Practical effects are expensive, but worth it. I had to smash seventeen stunt bioroids to get this shot." -Parvati Kapoor, director
data.title: Lateral Growth
data.text: Gain 4[credit]. You may install 1 card (paying the install cost).
When Improved Protein Source is scored or stolen, the Runner gains 4[credit].
data.flavor: They eat us, we eat them, the cycle goes on and on. -Omar Keung, "the Flashpoint"
data.title: Improved Protein Source
Voter Intimidation
data.text:
Play only if there is an agenda in the Runner's score area.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, trash 1 resource.

data.title: Harishchandra Ent.: Where You're the Star
data.flavor: We Know What You Want.
data.text: If the Runner is tagged, he or she plays with his or her grip revealed.

data.title: Full Immersion RecStudio
data.flavor: The costumes aren't strictly necessary, but they improve the performances of the vactors and sensie stars.
data.text:
Full Immersion RecStudio can host up to 2 assets and/or agendas.
The trash cost of Full Immersion RecStudio is increased by 3 for each card hosted on it.

This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [nbn] cards in your deck. As an additional cost to rez Ibrahim Salem, forfeit an agenda. When your turn begins, name a card type. Look at the Runner's grip and trash 1 card in it of the named type.
data.title: Ibrahim Salem
Navi Mumbai City Grid
data.flavor: The entertainment capital of Mumbad.
data.text: During a run on this server, the Runner cannot use paid abilities on non-icebreaker cards. Limit 1 region per server.

data.title: Zealous Judge
data.text:
Zealous Judge can only be rezzed if the Runner is tagged.
[click], 1[credit]: Give the Runner 1 tag.

data.title: Election Day
data.text: Trash all cards in HQ (minimum of 1). Draw 5 cards.
data.flavor: "A new administration means we have to start greasing the wheels all over again. Let's get to work."

data.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Play up to 2 operations from HQ (paying all costs), resolving them one at a time.
data.flavor: Judicious use of freelancers can increase efficiency and protect the company from legal repercussions. It's what they call a "win-win".
data.title: Subcontract

data.text: Merger is worth 1 additional agenda point while in the Runner's score area.
data.flavor: Survival of the fittest' is so outdated; in finance it's 'survival of the fattest.' -Omar Keung, "the Flashpoint"
data.title: Merger

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. Whenever the Corp draws 1 or more cards, he or she loses 1[credit] if it is not the first time he or she has drawn cards this turn.

Null: Whistleblower
data.text: Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may trash 1 card from your grip. If you do, that ice has -2 strength for the remainder of this run.
Whenever you approach a piece of ice, you may expose it. You may then trash GPI Net Tap to jack out.
data.flavor: Sometimes the itsy-bitsy data is most important.

data.flavor: "Take it from me, there is a point where you have so much money you stop caring. That's usually right before it all comes tumbling down."

Mind Game
data.text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, choose another server. The Runner is now running on that server instead of passing Mind Game. For the remainder of the run, the Runner must add 1 installed card to the bottom of his or her stack as an additional cost to jack out.

es.title: Mind Game
es.text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, choose another server. The Runner is now running on that server instead of passing Mind Game. For the remainder of the run, the Runner must add 1 installed card to the bottom of his or her stack as an additional cost to jack out.

If the Runner has fewer than 6[credit] or fewer than 2 cards in his or her grip when there is a successful run on this server, you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and swap 1 of those cards with a card in HQ. Limit 1 region per server.
es.title: Nihongai Grid

data.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, when you would access any number of cards from HQ, you may instead add that many cards from your heap to your grip. Remove Rip Deal from the game instead of trashing it.
data.title: Rip Deal

data.text:
6[credit]: Derez a sentry currently being encountered.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Flashbang
data.flavor: "It's my sentry cheat sheet" -Revenant

data.text: Make a run. If you have 3 or fewer programs installed, all icebreakers have +2 strength during this run.
data.title: Lean and Mean
data.flavor: "The question isn't 'should I do it?' the question is 'can I do it?'" -Kabonesa Wu

data.text:
Maven has +1 strength for each installed program.
2[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
data.title: Maven

data.text: During each run, Na'Not'K has +1 strength for each piece of ice protecting the attacked server. 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +2 strength.
data.title: Na'Not'K
data.flavor: "Anyone can hit someone where they are weakest." -S'onge Galaxy

data.title: Bloo Moose
data.flavor:
"Talk is free. Anything else is going to cost you."
-Jitish
data.text: When your turn begins, you may remove 1 card in the heap from the game. If you do, gain 2[credit].
The Runner may trash 1 card from his or her grip at random. If he or she does not, gain [click][click].
data.flavor:
"Is the lack of oxygen causing distress, friend?"
-Gregory 3D3R6Z
data.title: O₂ Shortage
Helheim Servers
data.text: Trash 1 card from HQ: All ice protecting this server has +2 strength until the end of the run. Use this ability only during a run on this server.

data.flavor: "As you'll see on page 276, section CDXXIX, paragraph 47, line 102 of your contract, you are overdue for your seed upgrade, and all growth from out of date seed is to be confiscated and destroyed."
data.title: Mandatory Seed Replacement
data.text: When you score Mandatory Seed Replacement, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers.

data.title: Water Monopoly
data.flavor: AgInfusion doesn't just have patents on nearly every plant seed that in farmed on Mars - they own most of the rights to the water that farms use.
data.text: The install cost of each non-virtual resource is increased by 1.

data.title: Metamorph
data.flavor: "My gift to runners: isomorphic architectural protocols. Ichiban daikirai da." -Midori
data.text: [subroutine] Swap 2 other installed pieces of ice or 2 of your installed non-ice cards.

When the Runner encounters Data Loop, he or she must add 2 cards from his or her grip to the top of the stack.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Data Loop
Biased Reporting
data.text: Choose resource, hardware or program. The Runner may trash any of his or her cards of that type, and gain 1[credit] for each card trashed. Gain 2[credit] for each installed card of the chosen type.
After your mandatory draw, reveal the top card of R&D and add it to HQ. Add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.
data.title: Open Forum
data.flavor:
"Please, speak freely. I've been tasked by the board itself to hear your grievances."
-Mandy Traut

data.text:
You may forfeit an agenda to rez Tithonium instead of paying its rez cost.
Tithonium cannot host cards.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 resource and end the run.
data.title: Tithonium
Transparency Initiative
data.text: Turn an agenda faceup and install Transparency Initiative on that agenda as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host agenda gains public. Whenever you advance host agenda, gain 1[credit]."

data.title: Rover Algorithm
data.text: Install Rover Algorithm on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host ice has +1 strength for each power counter on Rover Algorithm. Whenever the Runner passes host ice, place 1 power counter on Rover Algorithm."

data.title: Mining Accident
data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
The Corp must pay 5[credit] or take 1 bad publicity. Remove Mining Accident from the game instead of trashing it.

When you install Respirocytes, suffer 1 meat damage.
The first time you have 0 cards in your grip each turn, draw 1 card and place a power counter on Respirocytes. When Respirocytes has 3 or more power counters on it, trash it.
data.title: Respirocytes
Salvaged Vanadis Armory
data.flavor: Vanadis, a Martian arms manufacturer, was among the first sites targeted from orbit during the war.
data.text:
[trash]: The Corp trashes the top X cards of R&D. X is the amount of damage you have suffered this turn. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after suffering any amount of damage.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>

data.title: Aumakua
data.text:
Whenever you expose a card or access cards and do not steal or trash any of them, place 1 virus counter on Aumakua.
Aumakua has +1 strength for each virus counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
3[credit]: Prevent 1 net or brain damage.
data.title: Caldera
data.flavor: The electric pulses ripped through the Net, backtracking Los's location. When they hit his defenses, they spent themselves against the slope.

data.title: Diana's Hunt
data.text: Make a run. Whenever you encounter a piece of ice during this run, you may install a program from your grip, ignoring all costs. When this run ends, trash all programs installed using Diana's Hunt.

data.title: Reshape
data.flavor: "I wield the power cosmic - a galactic force that can reshape the Net!" -S'onge Galaxy
data.text: Swap 2 pieces of unrezzed ice.
Trash a card from your grip: Prevent an installed card of the same type from being trashed by the Corp.
data.flavor: "Aptly named." -g00ru
data.title: Dummy Box
Corporate Defector
data.flavor: He was suddenly very motivated to pass on confidential information.
data.text: Whenever the Corp spends a [click] to draw a card (not through a card effect), reveal that card.
When you score CFC Excavation Contract, gain 2[credit] for each rezzed bioroid.
data.flavor: "Sure, we also use human labor - they are more easily replaced." -Emil Merk
data.title: CFC Excavation Contract

data.text:
[click]: Place 1 power counter on MCA Austerity Policy. When the Runner's next turn begins, he or she loses [click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
[click],[trash], 3 hosted power counters: Gain [click],[click],[click],[click].

data.text: Install and rez 1 card from Archives (paying all costs). Remove all other copies of that card in Archives from the game.

data.text:
If Breached Dome is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Breached Dome, do 1 meat damage and trash the top card of the stack.

data.text: [subroutine] Move Sand Storm so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server). Trash Sand Storm.
data.flavor: By the time the data storm passed, the landscape was transformed, and she was hopelessly lost.
data.title: Sand Storm

data.text: The first time the Runner trashes a Corp card each turn, give him or her 1 tag.
data.flavor: Only NBN's sec teams were outfitted with systems that could read data flows and see into the Net.
data.title: AR-Enhanced Security
Rolling Brownout
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The play cost of each operation and event is increased by 1. The first time the Runner plays an event each turn, gain 1[credit].

As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
<trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag for each tag he or she has; if the Runner has no tags, give him or her 1 tag.

As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].

data.flavor: A ghost image of it could be made out in the static of his BMI. He hoped never to run across the real thing again.

data.flavor: A despicable web of outcasts and infamy, no government or corporation could effectively shut it down. If only because so many of their sysops, executives, and covert agents made use of it.

data.title: Spinal Modem

data.text:
2[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
X is the number of virus counters on Darwin.
When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 virus counter on Darwin.
data.title: Darwin

data.text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
data.title: Datasucker

data.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Force of Nature
data.flavor: It always strikes twice.
Something wicked this way comes.
data.title: Imp
data.text:
Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed.
Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you access at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed).
Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
data.title: Hemorrhage
data.flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.

data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
data.title: Mimic
data.flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.

data.title: Morning Star
data.flavor: Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines.

data.title: Ice Carver
data.flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
data.text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.

data.flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
data.text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from Liberated Account.
data.title: Liberated Account
Scrubber
data.flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.
The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
data.flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
data.title: Xanadu

data.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].
data.flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
data.title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional

data.text: Gain 3[credit].
data.flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
data.title: Easy Mark

data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
data.flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
data.title: Emergency Shutdown

data.text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
data.flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.
data.title: Forged Activation Orders
Inside Job
data.flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
data.text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.

data.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
data.text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Special Order
Doppelgänger
data.flavor: Twice the fun.
data.text: +1[mu] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.
Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
data.flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
data.title: HQ Interface
Aurora
data.text: 2[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.

data.flavor: Do you believe in faeries?
data.title: Faerie
data.text: 0[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.

data.title: Femme Fatale
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1[credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.

data.title: Peacock
data.flavor: Show-off.
data.text: 2[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.

X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.
data.title: Pheromones
Sneakdoor Beta
data.text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.
data.flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru

data.title: Bank Job
data.text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.

data.title: Crash Space
data.flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.
data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.

data.title: Fall Guy
data.text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].
data.flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.

data.title: Mr. Li
data.flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."
data.text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. Add 1 of these cards to the bottom of your stack.

data.flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"
data.title: Chaos Theory: Wünderkind
Diesel
data.flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
data.text: Draw 3 cards.

data.title: Indexing
data.flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.
data.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
data.flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
data.title: Modded

data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
data.flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.
data.title: Notoriety
Test Run
data.text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.

data.title: The Maker's Eye
data.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
data.flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak

data.title: Tinkering
data.text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
data.flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."

data.title: Dinosaurus
data.text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.

data.title: Rabbit Hole
data.text:
+1[link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.
data.flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.

data.title: The Personal Touch
data.flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…
data.text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.

data.title: Battering Ram
data.flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
data.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

data.title: Gordian Blade
data.flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
[click]: Gain 2[credit].
data.flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.
data.title: Magnum Opus

data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Pipeline
Aesop's Pawnshop
data.flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
data.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].

data.title: All-nighter
data.text: [click], [trash]: Gain [click][click].
data.flavor: "I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour

data.text: [trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
data.flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
data.title: Sacrificial Construct
Infiltration
data.text: Gain 2[credit] or expose 1 card.
data.flavor: "Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy

data.title: Sure Gamble
data.flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
data.text: Gain 9[credit].

data.title: Dyson Mem Chip
data.text: +1[mu], +1[link]
data.flavor: Archaic but reliable.

data.text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
[click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.
data.title: Crypsis
Armitage Codebusting
data.flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.
data.text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.

data.title: Underworld Contact
data.flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."
data.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have at least 2[link].
All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
data.flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.
data.title: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together
Project Ares
data.flavor: Who wants to start a war?
data.text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.
When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
data.title: Project Vitruvius

data.text:
Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[credit] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.
data.title: Adonis Campaign

data.text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.
data.title: Aggressive Secretary

data.flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.
data.title: Heimdall 1.0
data.text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.title: Hudson 1.0
data.flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
data.text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.

The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
data.title: Ichi 1.0
data.flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.

data.text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.flavor: Whrrrrr!
data.title: Rototurret

data.text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Viktor 1.0
data.flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
"Do you think they…feel it?"
data.text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
data.title: Archived Memories
Biotic Labor
data.text: Gain [click][click].
data.flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."

data.text: Gain 3[credit] and draw 1 card.
data.flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.
data.title: Green Level Clearance
Shipment from MirrorMorph
data.flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.
data.text: Immediately install up to 3 cards (spending no clicks but paying all install costs).

data.flavor: "Eyes forward please."
data.title: Ash 2X3ZB9CY
data.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 4</trace> if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.

Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.
data.title: Strongbox

data.text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.
data.flavor: Moving Upwards.
data.title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World

data.flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.
data.text: When you score Hostile takeover, gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Hostile Takeover
Project Atlas
data.text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.
data.flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."
data.title: The Cleaners
Dedicated Response Team
data.flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing
data.text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."
When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [click], [trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Elizabeth Mills
data.flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."
GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.
data.title: GRNDL Refinery
data.text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: Gain 4[credit] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.

As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Archer
data.flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.
A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.
data.title: Caduceus
data.text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, the Corp gains 3[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, end the run.

Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Hadrian's Wall
data.flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. his constructs live up to it though." -g00ru

data.text:
Hive loses an "[subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Hive

data.text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Ice Wall
data.flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security

data.text:
Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Shadow
data.flavor: Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows. -unsigned cyber-graffiti

data.text: Gain 3[credit].
data.flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.
data.title: Beanstalk Royalties

data.text:
<trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>
data.flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
data.title: Punitive Counterstrike
Shipment from Kaguya
data.flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."
data.text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.

data.title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution
data.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
data.flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.

data.title: Braintrust
data.text:
When you score Braintrust, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
The rez cost of all ice is lowered by 1 for each agenda counter on Braintrust.
Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
data.title: Nisei MK II
Project Junebug
data.text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.

Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage."
data.flavor: I will serve you…for a time.
data.title: Ronin
Snare!
data.text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.

data.flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
data.title: Himitsu-Bako
data.text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
data.title: Neural Katana
data.text: [subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
data.flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
data.title: Swordsman

data.text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
data.title: Wall of Thorns

data.text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.
data.title: Whirlpool
data.flavor: "This ice sucks." -g00ru

data.title: Yagura
data.flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
data.text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

data.flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.
data.title: Celebrity Gift
Neural EMP
data.flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.

data.title: Trick of Light
data.flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.
data.text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.

data.title: Hokusai Grid
data.flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.
data.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.

data.flavor: Someone is Always Watching.
data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
data.title: NBN: Making News

data.text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
data.title: Project Beale

data.flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."
data.text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: TGTBT
Ghost Branch
data.text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.

When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.
data.title: Data Raven

data.text: [subroutine]<trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.
data.title: Flare
data.flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.

data.text:
When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
data.flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." -Chaos Theory
data.title: Pop-up Window

data.text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."
data.title: Tollbooth
Wraparound
data.flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise
data.text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"
data.text: Draw 3 cards.
data.title: Anonymous Tip

data.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.
data.title: Closed Accounts
Psychographics
data.flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.
data.text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.

data.title: SEA Source
data.flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech
data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

data.title: Red Herrings
data.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5[credit] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.
Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 5</trace> if successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If unsuccessful, trash Bernice Mai.
data.flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.
data.title: Bernice Mai

data.text: Forfeit False Lead: The Runner loses [click][click], if able.
data.flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.
data.title: False Lead

data.flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"
data.title: Priority Requisition
data.text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.

data.title: Private Security Force
data.flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."
data.text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[click]: Do 1 meat damage."

data.title: Melange Mining Corp.
data.text: [click], [click], [click]: Gain 7[credit].
data.flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.

data.text: Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
data.title: PAD Campaign
data.flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.

data.text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."
data.title: Enigma

data.text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Hunter
data.flavor:
.//run/hunter-tr/return=true
client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y
3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR

data.text: [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Wall of Static
data.flavor: "There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?
data.text: Gain 9[credit].
data.title: Hedge Fund

data.flavor: Brought up in the slums of Jinja, Lewi made his fortune through back alley deals, well-placed bets, and savvy showmanship.
data.title: Lewi Guilherme
data.text:
When your turn begins, either lose 1[credit] or trash Lewi Guilherme.
The Corp's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.

data.title: Upya
data.flavor: New life through new understanding.
data.text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may place 1 power counter on Upya. [click], 3 hosted power counters: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.

data.title: Ikawah Project
data.flavor: "The average citizen of Nairobi speaks six languages.  Every culture, language, and ethnicity of the east of Africa collides here, collapses together.  What happens slowly by nature can happen quickly in our lab.  We will bring peace." - Dr. Muchina, Project Lead
data.text: As an additional cost to steal Ikawah Project, the Runner must spend [click] and 2[credit].

Gene Splicer can be advanced. When the runner accesses Gene Splicer, do 1 net damage for each advancement token on Gene Splicer. [click], 3 advancement tokens: Add Gene Splicer to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
data.title: Gene Splicer

data.text: [click], [click], [click]: Add Echo Chamber to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
data.title: Echo Chamber
data.flavor: "Capitalism runs on two things: amplified arrogance and censored dissent.  With those, a corp can create any environment it wants." - Freedom Khtemalo

data.title: Urban Renewal
data.text:
Place 3 power counters on Urban Renewal when it is rezzed.  When there are no power counters left on Urban Renewal, trash it and do 4 meat damage.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Urban Renewal.
Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, you may gain 1[credit] for each virus counter removed and trash Acacia.
data.flavor: The system is so deeply rooted, who knows how far the cables run?
data.title: Acacia

data.text: Whenever you draw a piece of ice, you may reveal it and install it protecting this server, lowering the install cost by 4[credit]. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Jinja City Grid
data.flavor: "The site of the world's second beanstalk, or I'll die trying." - Mirja Byanyima, Director of VSEP

data.title: Bacterial Programming
data.text: When Bacterial Programming is scored or stolen, you may look at the top 7 cards of R&D, add any number of them to HQ, trash any number of them, and arrange the rest in any order.

Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
The Runner loses 4[credit], if able.
data.flavor: He found it odd that three frozen yogurt shops, all less than a block from his, opened within the same week.
data.title: Economic Warfare

data.text:
When SSL Endorsement is scored or stolen, place 9[credit] from the bank on it.
When the Corp's turn begins, he or she may take 3[credit] from SSL Endorsement. This ability is active even while SSL Endorsement is in the Runner's score area.
data.title: SSL Endorsement
